in_ports.name: s
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] When specified, this data is just copied to "s" output before all other operations.
Can be convenient if you need to "build" this operation into some chain of other functions for debugging/logging needs.
Other inputs "x", "m", "s2", "x2", "m2" etc. are processed in the same way.

out_ports.name: output
out_ports.hint: String, that has been shown as the status.

out_ports.name: status_json
out_ports.hint: Full JSON status information of this executor or its caller, depending on "Modify status of caller" parameter.

out_ports.name: root_status_json
out_ports.hint: Full JSON status information of the root caller.

out_ports.name: s
out_ports.hint:
[Optional] Copy of "s" input, when it is specified: see comments to "s" input.
Other outputs "x", "m", "s2", "x2", "m2" etc. are also copies of the corresponding inputs.

controls.caption: Do action
controls.name: doAction
controls.description: If cleared, this function does not modify any status and does not fill "status_json" and "root_status_json" results. However, the main output port (desired status) is calculated and input ports "s", "x", "m", "s2", "x2"... are copied to output ports.

controls.caption: Pattern
controls.name: pattern
controls.description:
This function actually shows and returns this pattern, where $$$ substring is replaced with the input scalar. It is $$$ by default, that means simple showing the scalar. But you can use more complex patterns, like the following:
The scalar = "$$$"!
If there is no input scalar, this pattern is shown as-is.
Note that substrings \n and \r, appeared in this pattern (before replacing $$$), are replaced with the corresponding special characters (line separators).

controls.caption: Modify status of caller
controls.name: modifyCallerStatus
controls.description:
If set, this function modifies the status of the CALLER of this function, for example, status of some sub-chain that includes this function as one of its blocks. If there is no caller (this function is executed directly), no any status is modified.
Usually it is the correct expected behaviour: "status" of this function itself has no sense after it will finish execution. i.e. almost immediately. In particular, GUI, actually showing status line, may automatically clear it when this function will finish.
Recommended value is true.
